messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:35): one of the 300 new features in leopard seems remarkably useless
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:35): an on-screen braille display.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (08:36): the VoiceOver team wants everything made available through assistive technologies to also be on screen, for the sake of collaboration
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:40): i also like "support for open standards popular in the UNIX community such as the OASIS Open Document Format (ODF) or ECMA‚Äôs Office XML"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:40): whoever wrote this document has a highly tuned sense of humour
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (08:40): marketing? sense of humor?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:42): calling OOXML a standard "popular in the UNIX community" is funny :-P
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:42): marketing or not :-P
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:45): the tag is floating this idea of starting a subgroup to decide the semantics of http
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:45): wonders why that isn't the httpwg's job
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (08:49): why does http need semantics?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (08:49): I thought it was a network protocol
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:49): i didn't ask
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (08:49): are they going to define the semantics of TCP next?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:49): it seemed unwise to step into that discussion
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (08:50): maybe we should replace TCP with RDF triples sent over IP
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (08:50): ethernet-over-RDF-triples
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:50): i'm guessing it is indeed related to the SEMANTIC WEB though
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:50): oh wait, it's Semantic Web
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (08:57): I like the use of all caps
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (09:00): We could call some kind of pragmatic compromise between the RDF folk and the real world "the title-cased Semantic Web"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:02): holy crap
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:02): microsoft actually did something to support html5
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:02): http://www.consortiuminfo.org/standardsblog/article.php?story=20071016092352827
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:03): (see in particular the seventh paragraph)
a131216c7af242e66537a58b4ca7c9f9 (09:07): causing that group to "grind to a halt" helps html5?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:08): read the seventh paragraph
a131216c7af242e66537a58b4ca7c9f9 (09:09): the one that starts with

a131216c7af242e66537a58b4ca7c9f9 (09:09): The result is that a very important committee has, in the words of its Secretariat Manager in frequent pleas to the non-responsive members, "ground to a halt."
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:09): yes
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:09): second sentence
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:09): specifically, the listed specs

a131216c7af242e66537a58b4ca7c9f9 (09:10): 'The impact is significant, since this is the committee that controls standards such as RELAX NG (ISO/IEC 19757 Part 2), Schematron (ISO/IEC 19757 Part 3) and Topic Maps (ISO/IEC 13250) ‚Äì not to mention ODF and PDF (if will be interesting to see if participation increases when Microsoft's PDF-competing XML Paper Specification advances to SC 34 from Ecma, where it is currently in preparation).'
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:10): yeah
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:10): microsoft have managed to do what i've never been able to even work out how to do
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:10): kill relaxng and schematron :-P
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:10): not to mention odf and pdf :-P
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:11): seriously though, it's amazing how microsoft can screw things up
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:11): i'm really glad we have the html5 work structured in a way that they can't do that
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (09:15): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: have you tried to work out how to kill RELAX NG and Schematron? :-)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (09:15): occasionally, conformance requirements may look like an attempt :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:15): uh... no comment!
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:15): hides
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (09:16): network trouble
